bill_title: assess and tax renewable power companies.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assess and tax renewable power companies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. For the purposes of this Act, a renewable power company is any person who owns or leases any property for the purpose of generating or transmitting electricity for public use from a wind turbine that is not subject to § 49-34A-81. Section 2. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Company," a renewable power company defined in section 1 of this Act; (2) "Department," the Department of Revenue. Section 3. Any property owned or leased by a company shall be assessed annually for taxation by the department. However, any land leased by a company shall be assessed by the local director of equalization. Section 4. Each company shall file an annual report with the department by April fifteenth. The report covers the calendar year previous to the filing deadline. Section 5. With reference to property in each county, the annual report shall contain the following: (1) A legal description and value of all real estate used by the company to conduct business; (2) An itemized statement of the value of all equipment and other personal property not part of the real estate. The statement shall show the cost and the present or depreciated value; (3) The number of miles of pole lines; (4) The number of poles per mile and the length and size of poles; (5) The number of miles of wire and a detailed description of the wire; (6) The cost of constructing the wind turbines and lines and the present or depreciated value of the wind turbines and lines; (7) The type, amount, and value of any stock authorized and issued; (8) A balance sheet listing all assets and liabilities; (9) An income statement listing all receipts and expenses. Section 6. If any company fails to file the annual report by April fifteenth, the department may add twenty-five percent to the assessable value of the property of that company. Section 7. The department shall annually assess the property of each company on July fifth. When making the assessment, the department shall consider all reports, facts, and information filed by the company. The department may add any property omitted from the reports filed by each company. The department shall separately fix a value on any property located within the limits of any municipality. Section 8. The department shall consider the cost, market, and income approach when determining the fair market value of property for each company. In the market approach, the department shall consider the actual or market value of any outstanding stocks, outstanding bonds, and any indebtedness applicable to operating the company. In the income approach, the department shall consider the growth rate and inflation rate in determining the capitalization rate. Section 9. After completing the assessment, the department shall notify each company by mail of the amount of the assessment. The notification shall include a date when the company may appear before the department and be heard in any matter regarding the accuracy of the assessment. Section 10. After any hearing and before the fourth Monday in August, the department shall equalize the assessment and notify each company of the final assessment by mail. The department shall certify the final assessed value to the county auditor in each county where a company owns or leases property. Section 11. Each company shall file a map or blueprint with the county auditor in each county where a company owns or leases property. The map or blueprint shall show the location and length of power lines and the location of any other property owned or leased by the company. Section 12. Any company that completes construction by December 31, 2007, shall be assessed as follows: (1) Fifty percent of the final assessed value shall be used to calculate the taxes payable for the first five years after construction is completed; (2) Sixty percent of the final assessed value shall be used to calculate the taxes payable for the sixth year after construction is completed; (3) Seventy percent of the final assessed value shall be used to calculate the taxes payable for the seventh year after construction is completed; (4) Eighty percent of the final assessed value shall be used to calculate the taxes payable for the eighth year after construction is completed; (5) Ninety percent of the final assessed value shall be used to calculate the taxes payable for the ninth year after construction is completed; (6) One hundred percent of the final assessed value shall be used to calculate the taxes payable for the tenth year after construction is completed and for all subsequent years. Construction is considered complete when a wind turbine is generating and transmitting electricity.
